BREAKING: CNN Philippines holds exclusive interview with Chief Justice Maria Lourdes Sereno after the House Committee on Justice finds probable cause to impeach her.

Story here: http://cnn.ph/2FBetiL
Watch the first part here: http://cnn.ph/2DaI8tY

HIGHLIGHTS:
- Sereno on House panel vote: I knew the numbers were not in my favor
- Sereno: Serious perjury was being committed but the hearing still went on
- Sereno: My feelings are not important
- Sereno: In the Senate, we can easily debunk result of the psychological test
- Sereno: Let the public decide who has mood swings
- Sereno: Many wrong things were said about my SALN
- Sereno: Lawyers will speak on my SALN, quo warranto case
- Sereno: I paid a huge cost for what I believed in
- Sereno on impeachment controversy: I take one day at a time
- Sereno on Justice De Castro: Everybody is entitled to an opinion
- Sereno: In any fight, you must be ready to take the punches
- Sereno: I am focused on the delivery of justice, judicial independence
- Sereno on 13 judges urging her to take a leave: I don’t read anything into that, other than that I agreed to an indefinite leave. Let’s put it that way.
- Sereno: I haven't assessed the quo warranto petition
- Sereno: I had to clarify that this fight is larger than me... It has to do with judicial independence. Our judges are on the frontline every day. They get harassed, bullied, they get threats
- Sereno: On behalf of judges who are similarly situated as I am, I have to continue to fight
- Sereno on impeachment trial: I am quite advanced, ready to fight
- Sereno: Alex Poblador to lead my defense team
- Sereno says talk of 'betrayal' is 'not an issue for me'
- Sereno on House panel vote: At last, they made a decision...Sinimulan nila, wakasin na nila. Dalhin na nila sa Senado. Iyon lang panawagan ko.

Heart disease is among the top causes of death in the Philippines. According to the Department of Health, the risk factors and incidence of cardiovascular disease are rising. 

We get into the mind of engineer, architect and plumber of broken hearts - interventional cardiologist Dr. Fabio Enrique Posas of St. Luke’s Medical Center-Global City, who’s making great strides in heart surgery. He takes us through the wonders of the less invasive procedure known as Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement or TAVR, and his mission to make the Philippines more “heart-friendly.”

Let's take a look at President Rody Duterte's first year in office in the eyes of his own officials.

- A stray bullet hits a man inside the provincial capitol grounds in Marawi. Danger still extending to a supposed safe zone a month into the crisis.

- A North Cotabato town is recovering from a Moro rebel attack. Troops are clearing the area and more than a thousand still in evacuation centers.

- Tourism officials have a final answer on whether the country will host the Miss Universe pageant again this year.

summary: The San Miguel Beermen are favored to win the Commissioner's Cup, but TNT hopes the element of surprise can work to the Ka-Tropa's advantage in the PBA finals. www.cnn.ph

Sa lugar na nasa gitna ng matinding bakbakan, kaguluhan at kawalan ng pag-asa may puwang pa ba ang salitang kapayapaan? 

Ito ang Marawi — sentro ng sagupaan sa pagitan ng gobyerno at ng terorista grupo. Kasalukuyan mang naiipit sa gitna ng hidwaan, nangingibabaw pa rin ang iba't ibang kwento ng kabayanihan, sakripisyo at pagbangon.

Mapapanood ang CNN Philippines Presents: #InsideMarawi sa June 27, 8 p.m.

Islamic missionaries are facing charges for using fake identification cards.

While in Palawan, members of the new people's army set heavy construction equipment on fire in separate attacks. www.cnn.ph

As bombs fell in Marawi City, two mothers risked their lives to give birth.

Their children—born under the ravages of war —bear names marking this remarkable moment in their lives. www.cnn.ph
Netizens express concern over the attack in North Cotabato. www.cnn.ph

Join Pia Hontiveros tonight on #CNNPHNewsNight where we go above and beyond the headlines. www.cnn.ph

Our top stories:

- An exclusive bird's eye view of the devastation in Marawi: while on the ground, Maute fighters improvise with  homemade bombs. 

- 200 kilometers away from the war zone, Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters cause panic with an attack on a North Cotabato town.

- The PBA finals kicks off with a match between the San Miguel Beermen and Talk N' Text Katropa.

- The Kings are queens: Angelina and Joey Mead-King talk about coming out, falling in love, and staying in love.
EXCLUSIVE: Drone footage from Marawi war zone www.cnn.ph #InsideMarawi
Nilinaw ng mga otoridad na hindi isinailalim sa lockdown ang Eton Centris sa Quezon City kaninang umaga. | www.cnn.ph
Sabik na ang basketball fans sa unang laban ng San Miguel Beermen at TNT Katropa sa PBA Commissioner's Cup finals. | www.cnn.ph

Kamakailan ay nabahala ang ilang account holders ng Bank of the Philippine Islands. Nagkaroon kasi ng hindi otorisadong pagbabago sa balanse o lamang pera sa kanilang mga account. Ang ilan, nabawasan ang pera habang ang ilan naman, nadagdagan. Ilang araw lang ang lumipas, nangyari rin ito sa account holders naman ng BDO. 

Dinidinig ngayon ng Senado ang seguridad sa mga bangko sa Pilipinas. | www.cnn.ph

Isang buwan na mula nang sumiklab ang gera sa Marawi. Libo libo ang nawalan ng tirahan at 26 na sibilyan ang namatay nang maipit sa bakbakan sa pagitan ng gobyerno at ng grupong Maute. Sa pwersa ng gobyerno, 65 na ang namatay at mahigit 250 naman sa mga terorista.

Kahapon, pumunta si Pangulong Duterte sa Iligan City para humarap sa ilan sa mga nawalan ng tirahan sa Marawi City. | #InsideMarawi www.cnn.ph

#CNNPHProfiles celebrates Pride Month with the Kings!

We step into the world of entrepreneur, car enthusiast, and transgender woman Angelina Mead King and her model/TV host wife Joey Mead King, ahead of the premiere of their documentary series “The Kings.”
We get the lowdown on their struggles, fears, traumas, self-discovery, tests of love, and courage throughout Angie’s transition to womanhood and Joey’s own transition to accept the “new normal,” as well as her own demons.

Find out why we shouldn't be boxed into labels, their definition of true love, and how they’re rallying for more acceptance and understanding of the LGBT community. You don’t wanna miss this!
Tune in to Profiles tomorrow, June 21 at 9:30 pm on CNN Philippines. Replays on Thursday 7:30 am & 3:30 pm, Saturday 2 pm, Sunday 11 am, and Monday 11:30 am.

We mark Father’s Day on #CNNPHProfiles with seasoned actor, painter, writer, and father of eight, Pen Medina, who recently made waves online with the viral video of KFC’s search for the first Filipino Colonel Sanders.

Pen talks about how his father influenced his craft, highlights of his acting career, and life philosophies. He also opens up about fatherhood and his search for meaning.

Find out what makes the fierce and formidable artist cry, and the ideas that spark his art. We also get some insights about him from his family.

Don’t miss the fun with Pen Medina on Profiles, tonight at 9:30pm on CNN Philippines.

In this episode of On The Record, we tackle the changing media and social media landscape this 2016. We also discuss the proliferation of fake news and the so-called trolls.

We ask: Who are to blame for the spread of fake news? How can online users protect themselves from trolling and the like? Amidst the fast-paced digital reporting, how can journalists pursue their commitment to accuracy and accountability? How can we protect the truth?

Global Conversations takes a look back at the biggest world headlines this year. Global Conversations year-end special, Part 1 on Dec. 25 and Part 2 on Jan. 1 at 6: 30PM

description:
It's 2015 in review! Tinseltown is taking stock of which movies and performances are Oscar-worthy.  2015 brought us a quartet of breakout stars -- talented actors in roles that showed they're faces to remember -- as well as some movies that everyone, especially the actors and the studios who made them, would like to forget as soon as possible.  We'll also look back at some of the well-known Hollywood figures we lost this year. And, after tallying ticket sales all year long, we'll count down the biggest box office hits of 2015!
 
It's all ahead in the Hollywood Express year-end special!
Hollywood Express, tonight at 7PM on CNN Philippines
 
Replays  Dec. 24 at 11PM, Dec. 30 at 7PM, and Dec. 31 at 11PM.

Poe has had her share of controversies — more than enough she could handle that she is choosing to veer away from the controversial word war between fellow presidential candidates, Mar Roxas and Rody Duterte. http://bit.ly/1RRk1nO #TheFilipinoVotes

Fidel Ramos to Mar Roxas and Rody Duterte: "Act like a Philippine president that must be competitive nationally. The Philippine president must be world class. summary:
“Halos magkamukha lang kami," Sen. Miriam Defensor Santiago said of Davao City mayor and fellow presidential aspirant Rody Duterte.  "Kaya kami’y matalik na kaibigan. Kasi sometimes, we descend to the level of hyperbole. Pag sinosobra mo sinasabi mo, para mas epektibo, mas nakaka-catch ng attention, pero hindi naman literally true.” http://bit.ly/1McPQR5

#TheFilipinoVotes

"Ganito magsampalan kami. Kung hindi totoo ang Wharton degree ko, sampalin mo ko, hindi ako iilag. Pero kung totoo ang Wharton degree ko, sasampalin kita," said Mar Roxas to Rody Duterte. The Liberal Party presidential bet said he's now in the process of asking The Wharton School for his official records to prove that he is an alumnus. The Wharton website mentions Roxas as one of its notable graduates. Full report of Ina Andolong: http://bit.ly/1RMY6hH #TheFilipinoVotes

"Alam naman natin na sa kanyang mga pelikula, panay ang bugbog sa kanya sa umpisa, at halos matumba na, pero dahil nagkakaron siya ng lakas ng loob sa kanyang paniniwala na dapat depensahan ang mga nangangailangan at tumulong sa mga naaapi." The citizenship of Fernando Poe, Jr. was questioned in court before the 2004 elections. Now, Sen. Grace Poe is facing the same issue — only tougher. Two divisions of the Comelec rejected the senator's candidacy for president twice. Amid uncertainties of her future in politics, FPJ's daughter said she is turning to her late father for inspiration. http://bit.ly/1lHMUaf #TheFilipinoVotes

summary: Lights dazzle in Metro Manila with just a few days left before Christmas, and some places went all-out with their holiday spirit.

"In this contest for the presidency now, Digong [Rody Duterte] is the man to beat," says Liberal Party of the Philippines provincial chairman and Davao del Norte Gov. Rodolfo del Rosario. The LP stalwart, however, stressed that he remains committed to his party and its candidates. http://cnn.ph/1QbFUPe 

#TheFilipinoVotes

What happens if Grace Poe wins as president and Bongbong Marcos gets elected as vice president?
"Of course, I've thought about it," Marcos says. He claims that he has no problem with whoever would win the presidency but he will vote for Sen. Miriam Defensor Santiago as president in 2016. #TheFilipinoVotes http://cnn.ph/1OP3mif

COMELEC Philippines dismissed its own petition to declare Martin Diño as a nuisance candidate. The decision could make it possible for anyone from Diño's party, the PDP-Laban, to be his substitute in the presidential race. The poll body, however, has not ruled on the issue of substitution. cnn.ph/1LYbAQl #TheFilipinoVotes

"Sa ingay walang sablay, sa paputok may goodbye kamay," Department of Health (Philippines) Secretary Janette Garin says. She encourages the public to make use of alternative means of ringing in the new year. cnn.ph/1RyYwIp

summary: After getting admonished by Davao Archbishop Romulo Valles for his habit of cursing, Davao City Mayor Rodrigo Duterte volunteered to donate P1,000 to charity each time he swears. http://cnn.ph/1NLisIt

Rodrigo 'Robert Baratheon' Duterte? Mar 'Stannis Baratheon' Roxas? Grace 'Cersei Lannister' Poe? Miriam 'Mother of Dragons' Defensor Santiago? Jejomar 'Joffrey Baratheon' Binay? They say Philippine politics is like a soap opera, but one netizen took the analogy a step further by turning local politicians into characters from HBO's hit series, Game of Thrones. cnn.ph/1XN32m8

Rodrigo Duterte has accepted the challenge of Manila Auxiliary Bishop Broderick Pabillo to name his alleged abuser. But to file charges against the priest? "Ayaw ko yung sinusuggest nila na mag-file ako ng complaint. Patay na yung pari. And besides, I have forgiven him." http://cnn.ph/1Q4AoxH

"Walang konteksto, walang plano, panay batikos at hilaw na pangako." "Hindi ka magkapagpapatayo ng kalsada at hindi ka makakapagpakain ng nagugutom gamit lang ang Facebook." What are your thoughts on the veiled references of President Benigno Aquino III to those running against administration bet Mar Roxas? http://cnn.ph/1m0A2Mg #TheFilipinoVotes

Petitioner Antonio Contreras on Grace Poe's claim that political rivals are behind the cases filed against her: "Namasahe lang ako. Nagtaxi ako dito... Nagagastusan ako. Sabi mo, prinsipyo mo ang nagpapakilos sa iyo para ikaw ay tumakbo. Ako, prinsipyo ko rin ang nagpapapakilos sa akin para sabihin na hindi konstitusyonal ang pagtakbo mo." http://cnn.ph/1MYdR1W
#TheFilipinoVotes

A fire broke out along Quezon Boulevard, near Recto and Sta. Cruz, in Brgy. 310 in Manila on Friday morning (December 4). The fire is on general alarm as of 10:15 AM. 

This is a developing story. http://cnn.ph/1YMlUnT

Comelec Commissioner Luie Tito Guia defended his colleagues on Thursday (December 3) over a recent decision to disqualify Sen. Grace Poe from the presidential race. He dismissed allegations that the Comelec's members are biased because they are all Aquino appointees. http://cnn.ph/1MYcdNS

Comelec Chairman Andres "Andy" Bautista insisted on Thursday (December 3) that the poll body had jurisdiction over Sen. Grace Poe's disqualification cases — contrary to a statement made by his predecessor Sixto Brillantes Jr. that only the Presidential Electoral Tribunal can disqualify a president. This was after the poll body's Second Division disqualified Poe from seeking the presidency. http://cnn.ph/1Q2ozIm

Voting 5-4, the Senate Electoral Tribunal (SET) on Thursday (December 3) denied Rizalito David's appeal, and upheld its earlier ruling that Sen. Grace Poe was qualified to run in the 2013 senatorial elections. But Manuelito Luna, David's lawyer, said they would take the matter to the Supreme Court. description:
CNN Philippines’ top-rated primetime documentary block STORIES presents "A Path Appears".

From the authors of #1 New York Times best seller Half the Sky, Pulitzer Prize winner Nicholas D. Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn, come a 5-part documentary that highlights the oppression faced by women and girls around the globe, and the efforts to combat them. Featuring celebrity activists Malin Akerman, Mia Farrow, Ronan Farrow, Jennifer Garner, Regina Hall, Ashley Judd, Blake Lively, Eva Longoria, and Alfre Woodard. 

Stories: A Path Appears premieres September 13 at 8PM only on CNN Philippines.

#StoriesAPath

summary: "[N]ais naming ihayag sa kanya [Justice Secretary Leila de Lima] na tutal may panahon naman pala siya at may malaking interes sa Iglesia ni Cristo, eh baka pwede naman po na asikasuhin na po niya yung kanyang pananagutan. Bigyan din naman ng pansin yung nangyari doon sa SAF44," INC spokesperson Edwil Zabala told CNN Philippines on Saturday (August 29).

"[N]ais naming ihayag sa kanya [Justice Secretary Leila de Lima] na tutal may panahon naman pala siya at may malaking interes sa Iglesia ni Cristo, eh baka pwede naman po na asikasuhin na po niya yung kanyang pananagutan. Bigyan din naman ng pansin yung nangyari doon sa SAF44," INC spokesperson Edwil Zabala told CNN Philippines on Saturday (August 29).

"Ginagamit po namin yung karapatan namin upang payapang magtipon para ilabas ang aming hinaing at hingin po sa kanya, kay Kalihim De Lima, na ipatupad po niya ng patas, parehas ang isinasaad po ng batas," INC spokesperson Edwil Zabala told CNN Philippines on Saturday (August 29).

INC spokesperson Edwil Zabala: "Ginagamit po namin yung karapatan namin upang payapang magtipon para ilabas ang aming hinaing at hingin po sa kanya, kay Kalihim De Lima, na ipatupad po niya ng patas, parehas ang isinasaad po ng batas. At gayun din po, nais naming ihayag sa kanya na tutal may panahon naman pala siya at may malaking interes sa Iglesia ni Cristo, eh baka pwede naman po na asikasuhin na po niya yung kanyang pananagutan. Bigyan din naman ng pansin yung nangyari doon sa SAF44."

Former INC Minister Isaias Samson: "It is a desperate act, the Sanggunian wants to mobilize all the members of the church in order to protect them. That is the equivalent of going against the law. Why not allow the law to be followed? Anyway, it has been and it's always a doctrine in the church that we submit ourselves to the laws of the government and it is written in the Bible."

description: President Benigno Aquino III welcomed Thailand's Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha during his first official visit in the country. The two leaders talked about trade and investments, defense and security, and the strengthening of people-to-people ties.

summary:
Eddie Vega started running when he was 48 years old. To up his game for his 50th marathon last 2012, he decided to run barefoot in hot and dirty asphalt. He quickly gained attention for his bold move and he used that for a higher purpose. Vega is now giving back through an organization called Soles4Souls to help fight poverty through the distribution of shoes.

To watch more stories of the Filipino, go to http://cnnphilippines.com/thestoryofthefilipino/

#CNNPhilippines

description:
The CNN Philippines Traffic Center partnered with Waze to provide real time traffic information to help motorists and commuters make wise decisions on how to navigate through the metro traffic.

Set to premiere on June 1, the CNN Philippines Traffic Center will air Mondays to Fridays at 6:30 AM to 7:00 AM with Claudine Trillo, and at 5:45 PM to 6:00 PM with Menchu Macapagal.
